channel.title: Dynamic IP!
channel.description:
Hi, I've just realised that my ISP/IP address is dynamic, so when I give out my IP for people to connect to my PHP page (http://localhost/register.php/) (substitute localhost for my IP address), they won't always be able to connect, because when I'm asleep the IP might change.
Can I make my dynamic a static? Or can I/should I change it to my computer's IP address /dangerous?

item.title: Dynamic IP!
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

If you deem necessary.

Read full topic

@classic wrote:

Sending a Moderator to lock this now or…?

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic IP!
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Well, No-IP is how I realised my IP changed in the first place. Thanks for that, makes sense.

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic IP!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:7, topic:388247”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=484072.msg3546479#msg3546479 date=1301216761]

K well guess what… I just range my Internet Service Provider, 3G, and they said they don’t assign static IPs. Lol? I got put through to about 5 paki(stan) call centers, the bloke didn’t even know what I was going on about - some technical issues service…

Anyway to do it manually?

No-IP
[/quote]
I can aquire a static IP via No-IP? Bearing in mind I use my mobile phone as a dial-up connection.[/quote]

No-IP provides a DNS name for an IP. Basically what happens is you download No-IP, install etc, and it acts as a service on your computer. Then, the client(service on your computer) tells the server(No-IP site) the IP that the service is running on. Then when anyone tries to connect to your No-IP address(http://yournoipaddress.com/), the No-IP site “redirects” the user to the IP associated with the address.

tl;dr: If you use No-IP, you don’t need to worry about having a dynamic IP.

Read full topic

Anyway to do it manually?
[/quote]

No-IP[/quote]
I can aquire a static IP via No-IP? Bearing in mind I use my mobile phone as a dial-up connection.
